parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username used to authenticate with the service. Username and password credentials are only required to run your application locally or outside of Bluemix. When running on Bluemix, the credentials will be automatically loaded from the `VCAP_SERVICES` environment variable.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password used to authenticate with the service. Username and password credentials are only required to run your application locally or outside of Bluemix. When running on Bluemix, the credentials will be automatically loaded from the `VCAP_SERVICES` environment variable.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Release date of the API version in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: A maximum of 20 MB of content to analyze, though the service requires much less text; for more information, see [Providing sufficient input](https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/personality-insights/input.html#sufficient). A JSON request must conform to the **Content** model.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: The type of the input: application/json, text/html, or text/plain. A character encoding can be specified by including a `charset` parameter. For example, 'text/html;charset=utf-8'.

parameters.name: content_language
parameters.description: The language of the input text for the request: Arabic, English, Japanese, Korean, or Spanish. Regional variants are treated as their parent language; for example, `en-US` is interpreted as `en`.   The effect of the **Content-Language** parameter depends on the **Content-Type** parameter. When **Content-Type** is `text/plain` or `text/html`, **Content-Language** is the only way to specify the language. When **Content-Type** is `application/json`, **Content-Language** overrides a language specified with the **language** parameter of a **ContentItem** object, and content items that specify a different language are ignored; omit this parameter to base the language on the specification of the content items. You can specify any combination of languages for **Content-Language** and **Accept-Language**.

parameters.name: accept_language
parameters.description: The desired language of the response. For two-character arguments, regional variants are treated as their parent language; for example, `en-US` is interpreted as `en`. You can specify any combination of languages for the input and response content.

parameters.name: raw_scores
parameters.description: Whether a raw score in addition to a normalized percentile is returned for each characteristic; raw scores are not compared with a sample population.

parameters.name: csv_headers
parameters.description: Whether column labels are returned with a CSV response. Applies only when the **Accept** parameter is set to `text/csv`.

parameters.name: consumption_preferences
parameters.description: Whether consumption preferences are returned with the results.
